name: Main St Bozeman Condo - Walk to Parks & Eateries!
description: Escape to the unique mountainside town of Bozeman, Montana for a memorable getaway! Ideally located in historic downtown, this upscale 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom vacation rental provides easy access to the best attractions. Walk across the street to Lindley Park, check out the Museum of the Rockies, or take a scenic drive to Big Sky Resort for a day on the slopes. After a long day of hiking, fire up the condo's gas grill and admire the Bridger Mountain range from the balcony!
neighborhood_overview:
DOWNTOWN: Bozeman Bogert Farmer's Market (0.1 miles), Co-op West Main (1.3 miles), Emerson Center for the Arts & Culture (0.9 miles), Willson Auditorium (0.9 miles), Gallatin History Museum (0.9 miles), top-notch shops, restaurants, cafes, lounges & more
OUTDOOR RECREATION: Bridger Creek Golf Course (3.3 miles), Gallatin County Regional Park (4.4 miles), Boseman Hot Springs (8.9 miles), Montana Grizzly Encounter (11.1 miles), Bridger Bowl Ski Area (16.9 miles), Big Sky Resort (51.2 miles), Custer Gallatin National Forest (67.4 miles), Yellowstone National Park (87.4 miles), Helena National Forest (111.0 miles)
NEARBY TRAILS & PARKS: Lindley Park (across the street), City of Bozeman Bogert Park (0.6 miles), Peets Hill/Burke Park (0.7 miles), Gallagator Trail (0.8 miles), Story Hills Trail South Loop (2.4 miles), Painted Trails Access (2.5 miles), Bozeman Pond (3.3 miles), Gardner Park (3.5 miles), Tuckerman Park (4.1 miles)
FAMILY FUN: Bozeman Brewery Historic District

name: Downtown Bungalow - side door
description: Our Downtown Bungalow has the feel of a cottage in a quiet historic downtown neighborhood, two blocks from restaurants, pubs, shops, boutiques, groceries, historic theater, our beautiful library, parks, creeks, and walking trails. It is an ideal location for guests who are traveling through, college bound visitors, professors, students, skiers, bicyclers, families, etc. Guests without transportation are able to get around with ease to downtown, or walking distance to Montana State University.
host_about:
Welcome to Bozeman and our Downtown Bungalow with your own private entrance and lower level floor, two private bedrooms for individuals or groups, one with a queen bed, the other with one full and twin. There is a shared living room and beautiful bathroom with a Europen style shower, a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, utensils, coffee pot and tea kettle with ground coffee and teas. A bistro table and chairs await you in the garden for your use.
We are located on a quiet street, two blocks from Historic Main Street, restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, boutiques, Bogert Park with their Tuesday night Farmer's Market, a creek, outdoor pool, playground and the base of our amazing trail system from Main Street to the Mountains. We are walking distance to Montana State University, Museum of the Rockies, Bozeman High School, the Community Food Co-op, Bozeman Public Library, Bozeman Deaconess Hospital, and two blocks to our free bus service, including a free downtown shuttle to and from Bridger Bowl Ski Hill.

We are quite the artistic family.
Loretta is a fine artist and educator, muralist, gardener, and bicycler. She exhibits her paintings locally at Cello Gallery and teaches Art Workshops for Adults and children, including Plein Air Landscape Workshops,  Hike Bike Art Camp, plus Art and Sip Parties for all ages and occasions.
Jack is an architectural designer, historian, fine cook, and loves to read. 
He is a skier and hiker of our many local trails.
We love to travel and enjoy exploring nature.
We have two adult children in their twenties.
Our son is a writer and marketer for book publishing. Our daughter is a screen actress.
Our Moto:
Be Active. Explore Nature. Create Art.

name: *Luxury+Romance Downtown* Absolutely Dreamy Shower
description: The V2 Suite at Vintage House offers a refined and comfortable retreat in the heart of Downtown Bozeman. Designed with elegant furnishings and modern amenities, this space provides a relaxing and sophisticated stay. Just one block from Main Street, V2 offers easy access to Bozeman’s top restaurants, shopping, galleries, and nightlife. With endless outdoor activities nearby, it’s perfectly situated for those looking to explore both the city and Montana’s natural beauty.
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman is referred to as one of the “most livable places” for good reason! name: *Downtown for 4* Upscale + Walk to everything!
description: The V1 Suite at Vintage House provides a refined stay in the heart of Downtown Bozeman. Thoughtfully designed with elegant furnishings and modern comforts, this space offers a relaxing and sophisticated retreat. Just around the corner from Main Street, you’ll be steps from Bozeman’s best dining, shopping, art galleries, and nightlife. Whether exploring the vibrant downtown scene or heading outdoors for nearby adventures, this suite is perfectly situated for an unforgettable stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Bozeman is referred to as one of the “most livable places” for good reason! It is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter what time of year it is. Located in the heart of Downtown Bozeman, VRBozeman's properties offer something for everyone.

In the warmer months you can explore the mountains, fly fish on world renowned rivers and streams, mountain bike on miles of trails and enjoy several other outdoor activities. In the winter you are 45 minutes from the largest ski resort in America, Big Sky and 15 minutes from the local hill Bridger Bowl. There is Nordic skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing, hunting, snowmobiling and much more. If you need a break from the outdoors don’t fret. Bozeman has amazing eateries, shops, nightlife and offers a rich arts and cultural experience with a number of galleries, museums and historical points of interest.

This area is perfect for a family getaway, a romantic vacation, or even a solo trip.

The Bozeman Brewing Company. This is a great place to go after a day on the mountain or the river. The patrons are local. The owners and employees are friends. The beer is outstanding.

Bridger Brewing is across town on campus and also one of our favorites. The pizza at Bridger Brewing is excellent.

MAP brewing is a great place to have a beer.

The dive bars are The Filler, The Eagles, The Crystal, and The Hauf. Each often feature live music. The Hauf has live music nightly.

name: Cozy & Luxe "Lagom1Stay" Top Floor Loft Downtown
description: This cozy "Lagom" loft is a well appointed stay. A short walk to downtown Bozeman & MSU. Enjoy the local foodie & shopping scenes. Venture to Yellowstone National Park. Enjoy unforgettable Montana experiences hiking & biking in the mountains or fishing in the rivers. Hit the local world class Big Sky Ski Resort or Bridger Bowl, & soak in local Hot Springs. Retire in luxury & comfort while watching the sun peak over the Mountains from your private balcony. City Hosting Permit Number #STR20-00391
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy the quieter side of downtown "South-Side" Bozeman, Montana. Nestled in the "Gallatin Valley" surrounded by 7 Mountain ranges! During your stay at the "Cozy Lagom1 SOBO Loft," you will be located in a beautiful & walkable historically established neighborhood with mature trees. Montana State University is right up the road. Take a walk through "MSU" campus to "The Museum of the Rockies" where you may explore early history in the Rocky Mountain Western regions, dinosaur bones, fossils, special exhibits & planetarium shows. "Emerson Cultural Center, Rialto, Elm, & The Willson Auditorium" for performance/concert venues are all short walkable distances away. If you enjoy breezing through the city there are scooters strewn across the town during summer months. Walking distances to parks, playgrounds, & trails. Montana mornings & evenings tend to be on the cooler side no matter what time of year so don't forget to bring clothing options.

In the winter the fun is just beginnin
host_about:
We are Abigail & Eric! We are excited to have you stay! Born & raised Montanans, designer & builder come together to create a beautiful Montana experience just for you.  We are excited to help you navigate Montana & can send a guide on what to bring based on what adventures you plan on having. We have recommendations galore! Want to go skiing, hiking, have day trips, or enjoy fishing? Go out & have an incredible meal, enjoy local walks, & events? We are happy to assist. Montana is truly "Big Sky" country & has the ability to take your breath away. These trips are memories which last. 

Our family enjoys an array of outdoor adventures & love traveling to experience local moments wherever we go. We ski, snowboard, ice-skate, sled, hike, & dip into hot springs. On our hikes we love waterfalls & enjoy sitting around a fire in the mountains sipping on honey tea. Life is a sensory experience & we are thrilled to share these beautiful places we enjoy immensely with you.

name: Immaculate Downtown Bozeman Condo 1 Block off Main
description: Enjoy downtown Bozeman and beyond in this beautiful and cozy Montana Mid-Century Modern condo, a conveniently located 2020 construction only one block from Main! Perfect for couples or the single traveler, you'll have a reserved parking space, a fully-equipped kitchen, high speed WiFi, smart TV with cable, a private balcony to enjoy your morning coffee, convenient 24-7 keyless access from your phone (or a code), and many more amenities as described below. We look forward to welcoming you!
neighborhood_overview:
During your stay, you will be conveniently located in the heart of Bozeman.

Social life can be found less than a block to the north at Bozeman’s legendary “Barmuda Triangle”, a favorite collection of three unique drinking establishments popular among locals and visitors alike - the Molly Brown, the Scoop Bar, and the Haufbrau. (As an aside - the condo sits at the opposite side of the building as this area, so you won’t hear any noises from the famous “Triangle”. Just another perk of this particular unit!).

Also within a stone’s throw north, you can grab a bagel at Bagelworks, a cold treat from Sweet Peaks Ice Cream, or hit up Maven’s Market for some quality cheese and wine.

A few blocks west of the building you will find the Bozeman Co-Op, which offers a host of local and organic groceries in addition to a very popular soup, salad, and entrée buffet. Here you will also find a fine sampling of local beers and wine. If you're in the mood for delicious
host_about:
Ambrose is a front-end web developer, video game developer, and short-story writer. Jill is a software engineer, a violinist for the Bozeman Symphony Orchestra, a private math tutor, and fluent German speaker. We both love meeting new people and sharing the beauty of Bozeman.

As guests, we are respectful of the space, clean and tidy, laid back, and polite. We love exploring new areas,  eating at exotic restaurants, and learning about the local history and architecture. Being hosts ourselves, we are mindful of what goes into hosting and want to make things as easy and pleasant as possible for all parties.

name: Trailer Glamping of Story Hills
description: Welcome to the Trailer Glamper of Story Hills.  The best feature of our 33 ft trailer is the location.  Our property is 3 acres of mountain views and one mile from downtown.  It’s a short walk to local coffee shops, breweries, etc. Access Bozeman's trail system from our gate; Bridger Bowl  is 20 minutes away and MSU is 15 minutes by bike. We have the best of all worlds, a country feel, the amenities of a city, and easy access to wilderness adventures.
neighborhood_overview: We live in the ecclectic and unique Northeast side of Bozeman.  Its not trendy but is well known for the Wild Crumb Bakery, Mountains Walking Brewery, Fink's Deli and other local food trucks. The Story Mill Community Park is just outside our back gate and links you to an amazing trail system that takes you to the Bridger Mountains. Beautiful, historic, downtown Bozeman is one walkable mile away.
host_about: We have lived in Bozeman since 1991; married in 1998; and have owned this property since 2002. This is the place our three kids call home with space enough to ride horses, build snow forts and ski jumps, have huge backyard BBQ's and bonfires. Troy comes from an entrepreneurial background including the fitness business, film industry, insurance, and communication coaching. Lei-Anna has been in public education and currently consults with and travels to school districts around the country. We have a deep love and respect for the wilderness that surrounds us, the Greater Yellowstone, in addition to exercise, meditation, and a belief in a healthy organic and sustainable lifestyle.

Recommended Drinking Spots:
Feel free to take a growler or two to fill at one of our local craft breweries:

The Bozeman Brewing Company. This is a great place to go after a day on the mountain or the river. The patrons are local. The owners and employees are friends. The beer is outstanding.

Bridger Brewing is across town on campus and also one of our favorites. The pizza at Bridger Brewing is excellent.

MAP brewing is a great place to have a beer.

The dive bars are The Filler, The Eagles, The Crystal, and The Hauf. Each often feature live music. The Hauf has live music nightly.

name: Bozeman 303: Your Bozeman Basecamp!
description:
Welcome to Your Bozeman basecamp! Whether your outdoor adventure is hiking, skiing, or fishing, everything is within reach; including Big Sky Resort and Yellowstone National Park. Here for business, you found the perfect place. Our beautiful and efficient condo is a 15 minute drive from Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport, 60 minutes from Big Sky, 20 minutes from Bridger Bowl and steps away from Montana State University, great local shops, restaurants and grocery stores.

STR20-00399
neighborhood_overview: Nestled into one of Bozeman's iconic craftsman style neighborhoods from the early 1900's and just two blocks from both it's historic downtown and local food markets, Bozeman 303 is the perfect location. Hiking trails, world class skiing, natural hot springs and Yellowstone National Park are all just a short drive away.  Bozeman offers a wide variety of dining and shopping experiences. Whether you enjoy upscale or casual dining, a local microbrew from one of our 12 breweries or a hand crafted cocktail, downtown Bozeman has exactly what you are looking for. Seeking local art, antiques or books? How about gear for your next adventure? The shopping scene in Bozeman does not disappoint.

The street is quiet with really not much more traffic than residential.

description:
The Cowboy Inn, located in beautiful Bozeman, Montana, is nestled 2 blocks from the hip and historic downtown. Take advantage of this spectacular location with world class recreation just outside your doors. Situated in the heart of this booming Montana town, you’re a quick walk (or drive) to world class cuisine, shopping and 20 minutes from premier skiing. Enjoy this newly built condo, with contemporary and stylish amenities. Welcome to Bozeman, "the most livable town."
STR23-00064
neighborhood_overview:
Throughout the year, Bozeman is alive with activity. With festivals and outdoor concerts during the summer and endless outdoor summer and winter activities.

Enjoy the nearby hot springs, ski hills, trails, music events or the bustling downtown and get ready to explore! With downtown Bozeman minutes away (walking or driving), you are in the epicenter of Bozeman’s charm and can enjoy this booming little town and all it has to offer.

If you are looking to extend your adventures, you are just a short trip in any direction to the following:

21 min to Bridger Bowl Ski Mountain
90 min to Yellowstone National Park (Entrance)
25 min to Livingston
50 min to Big Sky
15 min to Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport

name: Smack Dab in the Middle of Bozeman!
description:
Here in the Heart of Bozeman life can be whatever you want: quiet and simple or exciting and adventurous--all in the same day!
Whether you're on vacation or working in the valley, we've outfitted our home to be YOUR home while you're here. We are excited to welcome you to Bozeman, and to invite you to enjoy all this beautiful area has to offer!
neighborhood_overview:
The Walton Homestead subdivision is a quiet and inviting neighborhood with a family-friendly atmosphere and views of the Bridger Mountains. The yard and an open space behind the house gives kids and four-legged friends a place to stretch their legs and there's a full park and playground less than one block away. (Note: the yard is NOT fenced.)
Being at almost the exact geographic center of Bozeman, you'll be minutes away from everything: shopping, groceries, fine dining, fast food, the Gallatin Valley Mall, gyms, hiking (at multiple regional parks within city limits,) coffee shops, bars, cinemas, live theater, music venues, spas and salons, bowling, the Bozeman Swim Center, the Bozeman Beach, churches, not to mention the real reason so many people want to visit Bozeman--the skiing, fishing, golfing, hiking, camping, climbing and dozens of other outdoor activities the people of this town love so much!

name: The Granny Flat
description:
Bright, spacious and clean 1 BR/1BA guesthouse. Complete with all amenities needed for a relaxing getaway, including king size Tuft and Needle bed (comfort heavily noted in our reviews), washer/dryer, Roku TV, high speed internet, and well equipped kitchen.

Short distance to West Side restaurants or downtown shops. Multiple nearby parks and ponds.

Apartment is over detached garage with an independent door leading to an enclosed stairwell.
neighborhood_overview:
Flanders Mill is a newer neighborhood on the west side of town. Wide sidewalks welcome you to take a nice walk or jog. Take a lap to one of the many parks both in and around the neighborhood. The Gallatin County Regional park is just a block away with a large fenced in dog park, a couple lakes, a kid friendly playground and additional walking paths.

If you're looking for a good meal, look no further than the The Market at Ferguson Farm, where you're sure to find something for everyone. A walk-able or bike-able dining and retail experience just a couple blocks south of the apartment.

name: Parks, trails and open spaces!
description: Come stay a couple days or a couple weeks. Lots of space indoors and out. Beautiful views of the mountains, big skies and urban open spaces. Magnificent sunrises and sunsets. Whether you are here to enjoy or here to work, this is the spot for you. We are nestled in a burb easily accessed from I90, but far enough away for peace and tranquility. The Streamline bus stop is just 3 blocks away for easy access to public transportation to downtown or other local destinations. License # STR21-00004
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in the northwest part of town. Our little burb is quite active. You'll see people walking, running or biking the trail all day. The playground is down our street 2 blocks to the south and the basketball courts are another 2 blocks past the basketball courts.

Don't worry if you forgot something at home. We have groceries, outdoor gear, beauty supplies, crafts, gaming, etc. within a 10 minute walk.

name: Chic Bozeman Apartment - 1 Block Off West Main St!
description: Nestled in the heart of Bozeman and featuring bright, welcoming style, this 1-bedroom, 1-bath apartment will host your next stay with ease! The vacation rental boasts multiple walkable restaurants, while a short drive will bring you to Montana State University, the Museum of the Rockies, and much more if you stay in town. Hop in the car to access Rocky Mountain fun in Yellowstone National Park, Bridger Bowl Ski Area, and Big Sky Resort, not to mention hiking in Custer Gallatin National Forest!

description: The Bozeman Retreat is just seven blocks from downtown and only a few blocks from midtown Bozeman. neighborhood_overview: The Bozeman Retreat is in the 'old' or original part of Bozeman. Homes in this area are a mix of original homes that were built in the 1930's to new homes like the Retreat. There is an elementary school a few blocks to the west. Downtown is five to seven blocks away. Bozeman Midtown is a growing area and this is about five blocks away. The street is quite with really not much more traffic than residential.

name: Downtown Bungalow - front door
description: Our Downtown Bungalow has the feel of a cottage in a quiet historic downtown neighborhood, two blocks from restaurants, pubs, shops, boutiques, groceries, historic theater, our beautiful library, parks, creeks, and walking trails. It is an ideal location for guests who are traveling through, college bound visitors, professors, students, skiers, bicyclers, families, etc. Guests without transportation are able to get around with ease to downtown or Montana State University.
neighborhood_overview: Our Downtown Bungalow has the feel of a cottage in a quiet historic downtown neighborhood, two blocks from restaurants, pubs, shops, boutiques, groceries, historic theater, our beautiful library, parks, creeks, and walking trails. It is an ideal location for guests who are traveling through, college bound visitors, professors, students, skiers, bicyclers, families, etc. Guests without transportation are able to get around with ease to downtown or Montana State University.
host_about:
Welcome to Bozeman and our Downtown Bungalow with your own private entrance and lower level floor, two private bedrooms for individuals or groups, one with a queen bed, the other with one full and twin. There is a shared living room and beautiful bathroom with a Europen style shower, a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, utensils, coffee pot and tea kettle with ground coffee and teas. A bistro table and chairs await you in the garden for your use.
We are located on a quiet street, two blocks from Historic Main Street, restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, boutiques, Bogert Park with their Tuesday night Farmer's Market, a creek, outdoor pool, playground and the base of our amazing trail system from Main Street to the Mountains. We are walking distance to Montana State University, Museum of the Rockies, Bozeman High School, the Community Food Co-op, Bozeman Public Library, Bozeman Deaconess Hospital, and two blocks to our free bus service, including a free downtown shuttle to and from Bridger Bowl Ski Hill.

We are quite the artistic family.
Loretta is a fine artist and educator, muralist, gardener, and bicycler. She exhibits her paintings locally at Cello Gallery and teaches Art Workshops for Adults and children, including Plein Air Landscape Workshops,  Hike Bike Art Camp, plus Art and Sip Parties for all ages and occasions.
Jack is an architectural designer, historian, fine cook, and loves to read. 
He is a skier and hiker of our many local trails.
We love to travel and enjoy exploring nature.
We have two adult children in their twenties.
Our son is a writer and marketer for book publishing. Our daughter is a screen actress.
Our Moto:
Be Active. Explore Nature. Create Art.

name: Beall Street Bungalow-3 blocks from Downtown
description: Welcome to Bozeman MT where skiing, fishing, hiking, and Yellowstone National Park are at your fingertips.  And if you are staying in Bozeman then why not stay steps from where all the buzz happens?  Our 1 bedroom with a king size bed, a Murphy pullout in the living room, and 1 bath house is located 3 blocks from the center of downtown.  Perfect for a couple or a traveling family. We are just steps away from restaurants, boutiques, coffee shops, theaters, and great bars.
neighborhood_overview: When visiting Bozeman there really is no better place to stay then right in the heart of downtown. Your house is 3 blocks away to the center of the downtown. There are so many great restaurants, boutiques, art galleries, coffee shops, beauty, and nightlife right around the corner from your location on Main Street. Nine blocks the other way gives you access to the shuttle that will take you directly to the ski area at Bridger Bowl.  You will also find a big park located just a block away. name: Downtown Bozeman Western Cottage
description: Enjoy this log home in Bozeman’s most soulful neighborhood.  Walkable to the famous Wild Crumb Bakery, Treeline Cafe, Mountains Walking Brewery, and Downtown Bozeman.  This 1940s traditional Montana cottage is the perfect retreat to experience life like a local.  Private patio with hot tub, off street parking, and a safe neighborhood will help you rest easy at night.
neighborhood_overview: We may be a bit biased, but we think our house boasts the absolute best location in all of Bozeman. Within a 5 minute walk of our home is an incredible bakery (Wild Crumb), the best coffee the city has to offer (Treeline), many great breweries, restaurants,  bars, the main street of town with cute shops, and trails galore webbing out from the Bozeman Public Library (yup,our library moonlights as a trailhead!) Despite being so close to everything,  the house is on an incredibly quiet street, nestled amongst other charming homes.
host_about:
Some #s: In the (13) years I’ve been on AirBnB, I've stayed in over (100) AirBnBs across (6) continents, rented out (5) of my living spaces while traveling, and met my (1)  husband while staying in his AirBnB.  

I aim to be a stellar host because I understand first hand how important accommodation is to a great experience on the road. 

I aim to be a stellar guest because I understand how personal it is to open up your home to travelers.

name: Western Magic - 3 Bedroom + Office Bozeman Condo
description: Western Magic is a spacious condo with 3 bedrooms, a fully equipped remote office with standup desk, supplies, & printer, and a fully stocked kitchen - to make the most of your Bozeman getaway. Enjoy a covered front patio for entertaining and relaxing, and a back patio for grilling with a large gas grill.  Located on the west edge of Bozeman, with views of the Bridgers and easy access to Big Sky or Bridger Bowl skiing, fly fishing, trails, downtown, and major stores. Family-friendly. No pets.
neighborhood_overview: This is a suburban neighborhood on the west side of Bozeman, with plenty of green space and walking trails close by that you can walk to from the condo. There is a lovely park a block away with a kids play area, and 4 blocks away is a set of walking/biking trails around 2 small "lakes", a larger kids play area and a picnic pavilion. Look out for Osprey dive bombing for fish in these lakes! Yes, you can fish in them. The neighborhood is a mix of families, students, and professionals. Be sure to drive slowly on the streets and be alert as there are joyful young kids who play outside in the neighborhood.
host_about:
Adventure mom, strategic marketer, sustainability & geotourism advocate.  I have 2 homes I rent when I am not in them, in Western North Carolina and in Bozeman, Montana. I know the WNC area around Bryson City, Nantahala Gorge, Sylva, Cherokee and across the park into Gatlinburg very well.  I also know the Bozeman and Greater Yellowstone Valley quite well after more than a decade of living there. I am a keen skier - alpine, telemark, xc classic and xc skate  as well as a fly fisherwoman, hiker, and biker. I love to help others find the right adventure activities, and places to go and see, for your vacation success.  

Hiking, float trips, white water rafting, lake paddling, waterfalls, mountain biking trails, best roads for road biking, best motorcycle touring roads, best skiing and rivers to fish are all things I'd love to help you find! Am very kid-centric, so am happy to be a great resource for the best things to do with kids from tiny tots to adventure loving teens.  I run an adventure tourism and travel marketing agency, so helping others find big and small adventures in cool places is in my DNA.

name: Access Friendly Location. Airport, MSU & Trails
description:
Bring the whole family (plus pet) for your basecamp in Bozeman. Ideally located near MSU, Yellowstone National Park and the airport for your work commute.

This spacious property offers an abundance of space for spreading your luggage out in each bedroom (3). A full kitchen is provided with use of pots, pans, Ninja blender, cast iron pans and more. High speed internet is included along with free parking.

This is a non-smoking household. Please enjoy at a near park and not in or at the house.
host_about: Avid outdoor enthusiast making the most out of exploring Montana and opening my doors to help you do the same! As a Bozeman resident for just over 3 years, originally hailing from the Great Lakes state of Michigan, I'm driven to put many miles in by foot, bike, skis and water ways. The state boasts incredible recreational opportunities with two spectacular National Parks and countless National Forests. Reach out as I'm always happy to recommend lovely meandering trails or delicious food around the area.

name: Clean & Cozy 2 Bedroom Suite - Near Downtown & MSU
description:
Base your Bozeman stay at our private, clean, cozy, bright, and convenient 2 queen bedroom/1 bath basement suite in our 1950s home near downtown and MSU. We can host up to 4 guests. 2 desks, WiFi, 2 Smart Roku TVs, laundry, linens & toiletries. Efficient kitchen and dining area.
Off street parking and separate guest entrance with keypad lock.
Near restaurants, breweries, coffee shops and more!
Minutes to downtown 5, MSU 5, Bridger Bowl 25, Big Sky 55, BZN airport 20.
neighborhood_overview:
Quiet, safe, centrally located residential neighborhood with quick access to Downtown, MSU, the interstate and the airport.

Cooper Park and the MSU campus are just a short walk away.

Grocery: There are 3 grocery stores (Safeway, Albertsons, Town n Country) ~3/4 of a mile away and the Community Food Coop is a 12 min walk/2 min drive away.
Pharmacy: CVS, Safeway and Osco pharmacies are nearby if you need medications or incedentals.
host_about:
Sarah and I love living in Bozeman but also like to travel and adventure throughout the western US and the world, often on bikes. At home we spend our free time outdoors hiking, running, riding mountain and gravel bikes in the summer and nordic skiing, snow biking, and ice climbing in the winter. When traveling we prioritize exploration and adventures.

As hosts we welcome you and try hard to provide a clean, comfortable, convenient, and affordable base for your Bozeman visit and adventures. We are happy to share years of local knowledge about fun things to do in the Bozeman area including hiking, skiing, backpacking, ice climbing, mountain-biking, visiting Yellowstone National Park, and places to shop or eat around town.

name: **Downtown Bozeman Historic Main Street Condo**
description: On Historic Main Street, this charming condo with alley access includes: a LED fireplace, granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, fully stocked kitchen, Smart TV with surround sound, at home work station, air exchange system bringing fresh air to the windowless basement, and pictures galore providing a picturesque motif of The Speak Easy Era.  Be a local in Downtown Bozeman enjoying the luxury of walking to your favorite restaurant, coffee house, park, cultural center and music venues!
neighborhood_overview:
Be a local and walk from your new home in Historic Downtown Bozeman to the many sights, eateries, and museums lining Main Street: Jam Eatery, Tree Line Coffee, Emerson Cultural Center, Ellen Theater, Gallatin History Museum, Rialto Music Venue, Bozeman Food Co-op, LuLulemon, Country Book Shelf, Schnees Shoes, Black Bird Kitchen, Theory Hair Salon, The Market Place, Backcountry Burger Bar and The Bozeman Public Library. Bozeman is where new vogue culture meets legendary history. Take it all in by living in the heart of what John Bozeman found so intriguing years ago.

Ready for an adventure? Rent a bike from Owenhouse Cycling and ride from Downtown on the Gallagator Trail south to The Museum of the Rockies and meet the local dinosaurs! Next, cycle around Montana State University to see what all the hype is about!! Then back home through the south side neighborhoods looking for the Historical Register lawn signs telling the tales of the old houses along the tree lined stree
host_about:
Hi, 
Welcome to Bozeman where my husband and I have been in the hospitality industry for close to 40 years. We owned and operated a restaurant on Main Street and most recently host vacation rentals. It is truly our passion, and it is our goal to meet your expectations for your time in Bozeman. We know the area like the back of our hand and would be delighted to answer questions and guide you in the right direction:)
We look forward to hosting you in 
Montana’s Big Sky Country!

In order to truly experience Bozeman and the abundance of attractions that make Montana "the most livable place", we would love for you to visit and even stay a while! Welcome to The Luxe Cottage: a luxury free standing condo offering both nightly and 30+ day stays, just minutes from downtown Bozeman with shopping and nightlife.

The Luxe Cottage was built with opulence, functionalism and attention to detail at the core of every design decision. A home away from home, Luxe is waiting for you.
host_about:
Howdy! Welcome to Montana. I was born and raised on a working horse ranch in the heart of Paradise Valley, specifically Tom Miner Basin along the banks of the Yellowstone River. My parents continue to thrive on the ranch while my siblings and I went out into the world to pursue educations and other interests. My love for Montana brought me home in 2012, when I launched my vacation rental management business- MonTanya Yellowstone Properties & Concierge.

I'm based in Livingston and look forward to welcoming and accommodating you in southwest Montana.

name: Modern Downtown Condo, block off Main Street!
description: This newly-built condo is exactly where you want to stay to get the full Bozeman experience! A short walk away from Main Street's highly rated restaurants and eclectic local shops. Close to Montana State University, making it easy to hop on a tour or explore the campus yourself. If you’re wanting to explore the Big Sky Country, this condo is a short drive from the outdoors and a has all the comforts of home when you’re ready to relax. Also, a perfect setup to work remotely.
neighborhood_overview: Downtown Bozeman is home to hundreds of thriving retailers, restaurants, and professional services. Bozeman and the entire greater Yellowstone region have so much to offer visitors. The quality of experiences enjoyed in Bozeman is largely determined by its amazing mountain setting which provides endless outdoor recreation opportunities. From skiing in the winter to fishing and hiking in the summer, Bozeman is a fabulous basecamp for exploring all that Southwest Montana has to offer. For being a small mountain town, Bozeman has a surprisingly impressive culinary scene. No matter what budget you're on or how picky you are, there are options for everyone, and the variety is growing by the day. Bozeman has every tasty bite you can imagine, from southern fried chicken to Korean bibimbap; from wood-fired pizza to fresh poke burritos. Bozeman is very fortunate to have a thriving arts and culture community. Highlights include our new “green” public library and the world-renowned Museum of the
host_about:
I am a working professional who works from home. I live in Bozeman, Montana for part of the year and rent my condo there out and travel frequently. 
I love living in Bozeman because of the natural beauty of Montana and the variety of outdoor activities that can be done year round with few crowds. Also, Bozeman has a friendly small mountain town feel with city conveniences including access to great restaurants, shopping, and nightlife. I am originally from Chicago and enjoy skiing, hiking, and riding a crossover motorcycle.

name: Garden Basement Apartment
description:
Our cozy apartment is in an ideal location near Montana State University and downtown Bozeman.

Whether you are traveling to Bozeman for work or adventure, it is the perfect home base. With a beautiful shared backyard, a park just one block away, and the Gallagator trail two blocks away, our home is a great place to experience all that Bozeman has to offer. Enjoy your stay in this cozy apartment, equipped with all of the comforts of home.
host_about:

Montana is for us, one of the best places and we hope that anyone who stays in our home will agree!

description:
"Awesome host, location and lodging!" -Seth

• Recently renovated chalet
• Sleeps 2 to 4 with queen bed & queen pullout sofa
• Full kitchen with breakfast bar
• Private bathroom with shower
• Dedicated workspace
• In-unit laundry and supplies
• Close to downtown & MSU
• Easy access to fishing, skiing, Yellowstone National Park, as well as hiking
and biking trails
• Half a block from large park and lake
• Book your escape and stay in this modern and homey chalet

neighborhood_overview:
This delightful Montana apartment for 4 is located in an upscale neighborhood of Bozeman. It’s a quiet and pleasant location that’s ideal for families or couples to escape to for a weekend, week, or longer, and for remote workers looking for somewhere to base themselves in Montana.

The property sits in the heart of walking & biking trails, parks, and all kinds of outdoor adventures, making it the perfect basecamp for getting out and seeing all that Bozeman and Montana have to offer on foot, bikes or by car.

Nearby places you might be interested in checking out during your stay include:

Yellowstone National Park - always a big attraction for people from all over the world with views, trails and landscapes you’ll remember for a lifetime.

Montana State University - the largest university in the state is close by, so if you’re a student or parents of a student looking to study here, the chalet is a great place to base yourselves while you’re chec
host_about:
I am a 30-something local resident of Bozeman, MT where I live and work as a VP at a digital transformation agency. 

I love traveling and spending time with my friends and family.  I enjoy all outdoor activities, hiking, backpacking, camping, fly fishing and watching football. 

Cheers!

neighborhood_overview: Gran Cielo is the manifestation of our dedication to create community through a common living space. While its million-dollar views, unmatched central park, and easy access to downtown Bozeman and the wild beyond make Gran Cielo an enticing location, it’s the sense of classic community that sets it apart. Whether you’re looking for your first home, a bit more space, or somewhere to settle indefinitely, Gran Cielo offers a sophisticated array of home types, sizes and styles. Unique architectural details and contemporary design draw residents in, but it’s the community’s centerpiece, a world class central park, that draws them together.

description: This special place is close to everything, making it easy to plan your visit. We are in the center of Bozeman with  it's wonderful restaurants and amazing downtown. The Bozeman's Main Stay is a historic home built in 1908 and one of a handful of homes still on Main St  We are just a short drive from Bridger Bowl and Big Sky ski resorts, as well as Yellowstone National Park and the world renowned Gallatin river.  Also minutes from the Yellowstone International airport, please come and enjoy.

Bozeman's main stay is located right on Main Street of Bozeman. We are so very close (just a block or two ) to the downtown area and its many wonderful restaurants and shops. We are also 1 block from The Wilson auditorium Which brings in the Bozeman Symphony and wonderful performances During the holidays.
We look forward to you staying with us.

name: The Sweet Spot - Downtown Bozeman
description:
The Sweet Spot , located in beautiful Bozeman, Montana, is nestled 2 blocks from the hip and historic downtown. Take advantage of this spectacular location with world class recreation just outside your doors, truly the SWEET SPOT. Situated in the heart of this booming Montana town, you’re a quick walk to world class cuisine, shopping and 20 minutes from premier skiing. Enjoy this newly built duplex, with contemporary and stylish amenities. Welcome to Bozeman, "the most livable town."
STR23-00052
neighborhood_overview:
Throughout the year, Bozeman is alive with activity. With festivals and outdoor concerts during the summer and endless outdoor summer and winter activities. Enjoy the being minutes away from the top fly fishing in the United States, ski hills, hiking trails, music events or the bustling downtown and get ready to explore! With downtown Bozeman minutes away (walking or driving), you are in the epicenter of Bozeman’s charm and can enjoy this booming little town and all it has to offer.

If you are looking to extend your adventures, you are just a short trip in any direction to the following:

21 min to Bridger Bowl Ski Mountain
90 min to Yellowstone National Park (Entrance)
30 min or less to the Gallatin, Yellowstone and Madison Rivers.
25 min to Livingston
50 min to Big Sky
15 min to Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport

name: (New Build) Townhome 10mins from Downtown
description:
Enjoy a centrally-located, newly-built townhome in the heart of Bozeman. The house is in a very safe area of the city, with friendly neighbors all around, and a beautiful view of the Bridger mountains. Across the street from the house is a large plot of farm land, which makes for amazing sunset viewing from the front porch.

When we say "centrally located", we mean...

- 10mins from downtown
- 1.5hrs from Gardiner (Yellowstone North Entrance)
- 1hr from Big Sky
- 35mins from Bridger Bowl.
neighborhood_overview: A beautiful little neighborhood located on the north side of Bozeman, about 1 mile from the freeway. Our neighborhood is filled with friendly people, a beautiful green, well-maintained park with a playground for kids. The drive to downtown is less than 10 minutes! We are in a well-populated area, so Ubers are typically an option, depending on the time of day.

Recommended Drinking Spots:
Feel free to take a growler or two to fill at one of our local craft breweries:

The Bozeman Brewing Company. This is a great place to go after a day on the mountain or the river. The patrons are local. The owners and employees are friends. The beer is outstanding.

Bridger Brewing is across town on campus and also one of our favorites. The pizza at Bridger Brewing is excellent.

MAP brewing is a great place to have a beer.

The dive bars are The Filler, The Eagles, The Crystal, and The Hauf. Each often feature live music. The Hauf has live music nightly.

Plonk and the Open Range feature outstanding mixed drinks, wine and beer imports.

name: Spacious 3Bdm Gallatin Green Condo | Trail Access
description:
Experience the best of Southwest Montana! This stunning condo has been thoughtfully designed for ultimate comfort, convenience, and entertainment. It offers high-end finishes, lots of space, and stylish furnishings to ensure an exceptional stay. Conveniently located on a trail system, the condo has easy access to various parks and playgrounds and serves as the perfect home base for your adventures.

*Fireplace & Smart TV
*Wifi + dedicated workspace
*Full kitchen & laundry
*Fantastic views
neighborhood_overview:
The condo is located in a residential neighborhood in Northwest Bozeman, offering a serene retreat while being conveniently close to shopping areas. It serves as an ideal base camp for exploring the many recreational opportunities for which Bozeman is known. Downtown Bozeman and Montana State University are just an 11-minute drive away, Bridger Bowl is approximately 28 minutes away, and Big Sky Resort is an hour's drive from the condo.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Lush Victorian garden with Bridger views
description:
Your family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located place.

This ground floor room with private bathroom is the perfect place to start your Bozeman and beyond adventures.

This room features a king size bed with a foam mattress.
neighborhood_overview:
The Northeast Neighborhood or the Brewery District, as it’s labeled on some maps, has a lot of history, a central location, and still has two active breweries. The original brewery, which is long since gone, was owned by the family who built their residence across the street in 1897. This house still stands today on our property as a private residence.

Today there are a lot of activities in the direct neighborhood and lots more in walking distance on Main Street. Near the Garden House you'll find Treeline Coffee, Wild Crumb Bakery, Fink's Deli, Mischa's Market, Mountains Walking Brewpub, and Bozone Brewing's tap room. There's something delicious available at most hours of the day.

neighborhood_overview: We are located in Valley West, an award winning family friendly planned community that has parks, walking trails, a lake with a pavilion and a playground all within walking distance. name: Peaceful Bozeman Retreat
description:
Newly-remodeled 2 BR/2BA gem, located in Bozeman's historic district, a 6 min walk from downtown and an 8 min walk to Wild Crumb Bakery, Treeline Coffee, and Mountains Walking Brewery.

Highly flexible space gives options for anywhere from 1 to 4 guests to spread out. Great space to relax after a day at Bridger or Big Sky. Loft bedroom also functions well as a workspace.

High speed wifi (600 mbps). Free onsite parking. Air conditioning.

neighborhood_overview: Amazing location: a five minute walk to Wild Crumb Bakery and Treeline Coffee, and mere steps from Mountains Walking and Bozeman Brewing. Endless trails nearby for walking, jogging, and biking. 20 min drive to Bridger Bowl and Crosscut Nordic Center.

name: Pet & Family Friendly | Central APT @ Westside
description:
Located on the Westside of Bozeman, 60 minutes to Big Sky Resort, 30 minutes to Bridger Bowl, 10 minutes to downtown Bozeman, 10 minutes to Montana State University, walking distance to shops and restaurants at The Market on the growing westside of town
Take a break between adventures to take advantage of the full coffee bar or take a nap on the premium king size bed.
-Private entrance
-Full kitchen
-Washer/Dryer
-2 beds, 1 King, 1 Full

neighborhood_overview:
Valley West is a great neighborhood on the west side of town with in walking distance to The Ridge ( a gym), a juice bar, a yoga studio, Polar Brewing ( brewery), restaurants Tanglewood, Sidewinders, Hachi Sushi, Foxtrot (also a coffee stop) .
The neighborhood is mostly full of families.
There is a nice mature tress and custom houses to enjoy a walk around with a cup of coffee. If you go a block east you will find a large pond full of ducks along with a community park with walking trails.
host_about:
Hello! I moved to Bozeman after college and stayed for the skiing and the community that I've built here the last 18 years. I enjoy hockey, skiing, snowboarding, mountain biking and rafting. 
For work I am a Vacation Rental Real Estate Investor and Construction Remodeler. 
I grew up in Idaho about 5 hours from here.
In the fall I love to make a nice breakfast and watch College Game day to hear about all the college football games.

name: Garden grotto with wood stove
description: Find yourself surrounded by a lush summer garden or peaceful winter snow in this beautiful room with walk out private garden terrace. Sporting high ceilings from the completely new foundation supporting this fully renovated 1890 building, this room is cozy yet expansive. When you step out of the sliding glass doors to your private terrace, you forget that you're in the middle of downtown. The sunken nature of this pristine space makes the outside city fall away.
neighborhood_overview:
The Northeast Neighborhood or the Brewery District, as it’s labeled on some maps, has a lot of history, a central location, and still has two active breweries. The original brewery, which is long since gone, was owned by the family who built their residence across the street in 1897. This house still stands today on our property as a private residence.

Today there are a lot of activities in the direct neighborhood and lots more in walking distance on Main Street. Near the Garden House you'll find Treeline Coffee, Wild Crumb Bakery, Fink's Deli, Mischa's Market, Mountains Walking Brewpub, and Bozone Brewing's tap room. There's something delicious available at most hours of the day.

name: Epic Downtown Locale. Trails, views, more!
description:
Live the Bozeman life.

Four blocks from the heart of Downtown and mere feet from Bozeman’s most cherished parks, trails and panoramic mountain views, experience the true essence of Bozeman at ‘Peets Story’.

Classically modern with rustic boho chic decor and a local’s flare, you’ll fall in love with our cozy, remodeled historic home nestled in the coveted Southside of Bozeman.
host_about: Proud father of two young men and husband to a beautiful, amazing wife, I was born and raised in spectacular Bozeman, Montana a hometown that I cherish and brag about every day. My work is in the field of genetic diagnostics, a fulfilling career helping provide hope to rare and undiagnosed children. I travel regularly for work and personally with my family where our preference is alway Airbnb. :-)

The home is situated in the newly developed residential area of Bridger Vale on Bozeman's north side, offering stunning views and a peaceful ambiance. This area is home to Bozeman Beach, a popular summer destination bustling with swimmers, paddle-boarders, small watercraft, and beach volleyball enthusiasts. Just across the water or a short drive away, you can enjoy MAP Brewing and various other local amenities.

Get to downtown Bozeman in approximately 7 minutes by vehicle! Here you will find everything you need including grocery stores, pharmacies, shopping, dining, and more!

With easy access to I-90 and only 16 miles to Bridger Bowl, this is a perfect location for exploring all that Bozeman and the Gallatin Valley have to offer.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone Nationa

neighborhood_overview:
South of Main Street filled with some of Bozeman’s most historic residences. Quiet streets lined with mature trees and towering Victorian-era homes distinguish this neighborhood. Residences are generally on smaller lots, with many having multiple units and shared back alley access. The Gallagator Linear Trail meanders throughout, connecting neighbors from Main Street to Kagy.

Great for those that want to stay in historic “old Bozeman” and be within walking distance from farmer’s markets and downtown events.

1-4 minutes to downtown

name: Downtown Dream house
description:
Your family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located home. Lots of space both inside and out. Lovely yard with fire pit, a front porch with rockers, and a breeze way for easy dry access to the kitchen or a great place to grill and hang out. Walk to campus and town from this convenient location.

3 bedrooms, two up and one down, each with a queen bed, 2 full baths w/towels etc, kitchen, dining-room and livingroom have loads of windows. Stone fireplace adds extra charm.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

description:

We have everything you need to feel at home from hotel grade bedding to a twinkle lit porch. Use the garage to park, play, or store your gear.

Perfect location! 5 miles from charming downtown and Montana State University, 10 from the airport, 20 from Bridger Bowl Ski area, and 40 from Big Sky.
neighborhood_overview: Safe neighborhood with multiple parks, ponds, and well maintained sidewalks.

description:
Discover serenity at the NamaStay Condo Retreat, a haven of tranquility nestled in the heart of Beautiful Downtown Bozeman, Montana. Immerse yourself in a space thoughtfully adorned with a yoga-inspired touches, offering luxury and comfort for a truly rejuvenating escape. Just moments away from vibrant Main Street, NamaStay invites you to explore the city's delightful array of eateries, boutiques, artistic gems, and vibrant nightlife. Embrace the perfect union of urban convenient.
STR23-00086
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman is referred to as one of the “most livable places” for good reason! It is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter what time of year it is. Located in the heart of Downtown Bozeman, VRBozeman's properties offer something for everyone. In the warmer months you can explore the mountains, fly fish on world renowned rivers and streams, mountain bike on miles of trails and enjoy several other outdoor activities. In the winter you are 45 minutes from the largest ski resort in America, Big Sky and 15 minutes from the local hill Bridger Bowl. There is Nordic skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing, hunting, snowmobiling and much more. If you need a break from the outdoors don’t fret. Bozeman has amazing eateries, shops, nightlife and offers a rich arts and cultural experience with a number of galleries, museums and historical points of interest. This area is perfect for a family getaway, a romantic vacation, or even a solo trip. Come and explore all tha

name: Spacious 1Bdrm Guest Suite Near MSU and Downtown
description:
This modern basement apartment offers abundant natural light and a clean, functional layout. Designed by the homeowner as a guest suite for family and friends, it features new, comfortable furnishings and offers ample privacy from the main house. Step outside to the backyard and enjoy the fresh mountain air.

*Wifi + dedicated workspace
*Kitchenette great for reheating and storing food
*Family-friendly w/ amenities catering to children
*Plenty of essentials
*Close to MSU and Downtown
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment resides in a secure residential neighborhood, conveniently located just 1.8 miles south of the Museum of the Rockies and MSU. It's surrounded by parks, walking trails, mature trees, manicured lawns, and families.

The home is 3 miles from downtown Bozeman, 14 miles from Bozeman Airport, 20 miles from Bridger Bowl ski area, 50 miles from Big Sky Resort, 80 miles from Gardiner (North Entrance to Yellowstone National Park), and 90 miles from West Yellowstone.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries. You're a walk or a bike ride
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Mountain Room – Walk to Farmers Market & Festival
description:
🥾 The Mountain Room – TrailheadSummer Stay
Steps from Peets Hill and Bozeman’s best trail access, this cozy private room is your launchpad for summer hikes and downtown adventures. Walk to the Farmers Market, all the summer festivals, and Main Street eats. Includes a private bedroom plus shared kitchen, bath, and living room for a clean, comfy stay.
neighborhood_overview:
You’re perfectly placed to enjoy the best of Bozeman’s summer scene. Just a short walk from your door are Bogert and Lindley Parks, home to the outdoor pool, pickleball courts, and beloved summer festivals and farmers markets. Right outside, Peets Hill offers easy access to miles of scenic trails with sunrise views and golden hour strolls.

A few blocks away, Historic Downtown Bozeman buzzes with shops, bars, and local eateries, while the Bozeman Public Library makes a peaceful spot for reading or co-working.

Need a lift? Public transit options like Streamline and Skyline are just down the street, offering easy access around town or even out to Bridger Bowl or Big Sky.

🚲 Prefer to cruise? We’ve got bikes available by the carport—yours to borrow anytime during your stay!
host_about: I’m a Bozeman native who loves sharing Montana’s beauty and charm! I’ve poured heart and soul into this space to create a warm, welcoming retreat—perfect for travelers who want to relax, explore, and connect with the magic of Bozeman. Whether you’re hitting the slopes, hiking trails, or discovering local gems downtown, I’m here to make your stay unforgettable. Need tips or help? Just reach out—I’m always happy to assist. Welcome to Bozeman!

name: Luxury Mountain Views Downtown Bozeman
description:
Welcome to our exquisite luxury townhome in the heart of Bozeman, Montana, where modern comfort meets the rugged beauty of the Big Sky State. This newly constructed 4-bedroom, 4-bathroom haven is the perfect retreat for those seeking an authentic modern Montana living experience.


STR23-00099
neighborhood_overview:
Step outside, and you'll discover your own private outdoor oasis. The townhome is nestled adjacent to the tranquil Glen Lake Rotary Park, offering a serene backdrop to your Montana escape. Spend your mornings sipping coffee on the deck, listening to the sounds of nature, or fire up the grill for a delicious barbecue while taking in the stunning surroundings.

For outdoor enthusiasts, this property is a dream come true. With immediate access to hiking and biking trails, you can explore the beauty of Montana right from your doorstep. In the winter, nearby skiing and snowboarding opportunities await in the Bridger Mountains, providing year-round adventure.

Josiah & The Team

name: Pagoda Peaks | Modern Luxury Near Bozeman Beach
description: Welcome to Pagoda Peaks, your serene Bozeman escape! Overlooking Bozeman Beach with unobstructed views of the Bridger Mountains, this stunning home invites you to paddle board, swim, or explore nearby walking trails. Thoughtfully curated by a professional interior designer, each piece inside is collected from travels across Asia and beyond. Crafted for slow mornings, golden hours, and unforgettable stays. Welcome to Bozeman, “the most livable town."
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the highly sought-after Bridger Vale community, this home sits directly on Bozeman Beach, offering easy access to walking trails, paddleboarding, and mountain views right outside your door. With a peaceful, residential feel and stunning views of the Bridger Mountains, it’s the perfect blend of quiet retreat and central location.

You’re just:

5 minutes to Historic Downtown Bozeman – known for its vibrant local shops, restaurants, coffee spots, and lively art scene

15 minutes to Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport (BZN)

1 hour 30 minutes to the North Entrance of Yellowstone National Park (via Gardiner) – perfect for a scenic day trip filled with wildlife and geothermal wonders

1 hour to Big Sky Resort – for world-class skiing, hiking, and mountain adventures

This location offers the best of all worlds: modern comfort, serene surroundings, and quick access to everything that makes Bozeman unforgettable.

neighborhood_overview:
Beyond the confines of this home away from home, Bozeman's cultural and natural treasures await. Find yourself just minutes from artisan boutiques, eclectic eateries, and buzzing nightlife downtown. Whether you're here for a weekend getaway or a comprehensive exploration of Bozeman's charm, this mid-century marvel stands ready to become your personal basecamp for a journey steeped in comfort and style. The soul of the past meets the spirit of the present, right here, beneath the vast Montana skies. Welcome home!

description:
* 4 Bed/4 bath
* 3 King Suites
* Bunkroom
* Gorgeous mountain or lake views from every room
* Smart TVs in all rooms

neighborhood_overview:
Nestled within a quaint development of 20 recently built luxury townhomes, our residence offers a prime location directly opposite Glen Rotary Lake. This picturesque lake provides a gateway to various recreational activities such as fishing, swimming, and kayaking. The surrounding area features a scenic walking path encircling the lake, leading conveniently to the MAP Brewing Company—a fantastic spot for dining, drinks, and live music. Step out the back door, and you'll discover an extensive network of hiking and biking trails that wind their way alongside the scenic East Gallatin River.

Within walking distance, you'll also find Gildhouse Suites, a venue that houses a delightful coffee shop and a comprehensive salon/spa experience.

The convenience continues with our home being just minutes away from downtown Bozeman, while a short 20-minute drive takes you to the slopes of Bridger Ski Resort. Enjoy the perfect blend of tranquility and accessibility at our locatio
host_about: Hello! Thank you for considering a stay at our home! We are an active family that loves to travel. We also love hosting fellow travelers! We are available for questions 8am-6pm MST or in case of emergency.

name: Spacious Family Home | Privacy, Backyard w/ Patio
description:
Have fun making memories in this nostalgic, family-friendly retreat! The spacious backyard with a patio and outdoor seating is perfect for family fun and relaxation. With 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, and ample space, you'll enjoy all the amenities for a convenient and comfortable stay.

*Full kitchen
*Two living rooms
*Highchair and Pack 'n Play
*Dedicated workspace
*Washer and dryer
*Beautiful location
neighborhood_overview:
The home is nestled in a charming, tree-lined residential area of Bozeman, offering a serene neighborhood atmosphere while being conveniently close to essential businesses and exciting attractions.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries.

It’s less than a mile to Gallatin Valley Mall and Whole Foods and 2.7 miles to downtown Bozeman. Find cute coffee shops, great dining options, bars, cool boutiques, and much more in the vibrant downtown! The home is also 10 miles to the airport, 20 miles to Bridger Bowl, 47 miles to Big Sky Resort, and
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Fisherman’s Folly
description:
Enjoy a stylish experience, within a spacious centrally-located home.

Fully remodeled mid-century. Ten minute walk to main street with its restaurants, breweries, boutiques and galleries.

This is the owner’s principal residence so they’ve made it very warm and comfortable.

Double doors open to a patio and large backyard filled with plantings and whimsical touches. On the front side theres a lovely sitting area with a solo fire stove to enjoy.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

Separate entrance. Free onsite parking spot.

name: Downtown Chic Urban Abode
description: Located in downtown Bozeman this fully renovated condo is housed in a historical commercial building on Main Street. With an alley exit you will be within walking distance of your favorite restaurants, theaters, stores and coffee houses. Amenities include: a fully equipped kitchen, granite countertops, gallery lighting, collectible art prints, high-end furniture, library, wood floors, high ceilings, laundry, smart tv, separate heat and air conditioning.  Quiet and cozy;this home is a hidden gem!
neighborhood_overview: The walkability is amazing from the condo with restaurants, coffee houses, retail stores, libraries, museums, co-ops, theaters, cultural centers all within walking distance.
host_about:
Hi, 
Welcome to Bozeman where my husband and I have been in the hospitality industry for close to 40 years. We owned and operated a restaurant on Main Street and most recently host vacation rentals. It is truly our passion, and it is our goal to meet your expectations for your time in Bozeman. We know the area like the back of our hand and would be delighted to answer questions and guide you in the right direction:)
We look forward to hosting you in 
Montana’s Big Sky Country!

name: Modern townhouse - views, near MSU & downtown!
description: *Minimum 30-day rental* Spacious, modern townhome in Bozeman, across from open farmland & surrounded by stunning mountain views. The Western decor, luxury finishes and vaulted living room ceiling provide a relaxing setting. The open plan includes a beautiful stone fireplace and a well-equipped kitchen with island seating that opens to a covered patio. < 2 hours to Yellowstone & <1 hour from skiing at Big Sky and Bridger Bowl. Easy access to hiking trails, fishing & other recreational activities!
neighborhood_overview: Alder Creek is a quiet neighborhood on Bozeman's southside with a park-like feel. It has fantastic mountain views, scenic walking trails, a central park and Alder Creek running through the area. The neighborhood consists of modern homes designed for family living. It is located just a short walk from Montana State University and has easy access to a variety of outdoor recreation areas, hiking rails and ski areas in and around Bozeman.

name: Modern Bozeman Escape w/ Bridger Mountain Views!
description: Experience a trip to Montana from this spacious 4-bedroom, 4-bath townhome with stunning mountain views. Located a few miles from downtown Bozeman and close to outdoor adventures, this vacation rental is the perfect home base. Walk to the waterfront at Glen Rotary Park, hit the slopes at Bridger Bowl Ski Area, or spend a day exploring Yellowstone National Park. After a day of adventure, relax by the fireplace or gather around the dining table for a memorable evening with family and friends.
neighborhood_overview:
DOWNTOWN SITES (~2 miles): Bozeman Co-op West Main, Emerson Center for the Arts & Culture, Willson Auditorium, Gallatin History Museum, City of Bozeman Bogert Park, Peets Hill/Burke Park, Lindley Park, Gallagator Trail, shops, restaurants, cafes, lounges
OUTDOOR RECREATION: Glen Rotary Park (on-site), Bridger Creek Golf Course (2 miles), Gallatin County Regional Park (4 miles), Montana Grizzly Encounter (14 miles), Bridger Bowl Ski Area (16 miles), Custer Gallatin National Forest (66 miles), Yellowstone National Park (80 miles)
FAMILY ATTRACTIONS: Bozeman Brewery Historic District (2 miles), Montana State University (3 miles), Museum of the Rockies (4 miles)
AIRPORT: Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport (9 miles)

name: Bozeman Bungalow: Pet Friendly w/ Fenced Yard
description: Centrally-located in Bozeman’s west side neighborhood this 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom townhome is perfect for your long stay. A fenced yard, covered patio and peaceful outdoor space are yours to relax in. Directly across from a 9 acre park, with a stunning view of Bozeman’s Bridger mountains. There is a one car garage for parking or extra storage needs. The open space kitchen, dining and living room with vaulted ceilings are perfect for preparing meals or relaxing after a full day of adventure.
neighborhood_overview: Located on Bozeman's west side near the newly built Gallatin High School. This townhome is directly across from a large city park, perfect to go walk with your dog. This is a quite neighborhood with families located about 4 miles from downtown Bozeman.
host_about: Hello! I am a thirty something enjoying life in Bozeman, Montana. I grew up in the Seattle, WA area but moved to Bozeman 20 years ago to attend Montana State University. After college, I traveled for the next few years to recruit students to attend MSU. I was able to travel all around Montana and many other states from Alaska to Virginia. The last few years I have ignited my passion for pets and gotten involved in the retail pet industry.

neighborhood_overview:
The Southbridge subdivision in Bozeman, Montana, offers a charming and picturesque setting for short-term rental homes, nestled within the stunning natural beauty of the Gallatin Valley. Bozeman itself is a vibrant and thriving city renowned for its unique blend of outdoor adventure, cultural attractions, and small-town charm.

Southbridge is ideally situated just a short distance from downtown Bozeman, providing guests with convenient access to a plethora of dining, shopping, and entertainment options. The subdivision boasts well-maintained streets lined with beautiful homes, offering a tranquil retreat for visitors seeking relaxation and rejuvenation.

Nature enthusiasts will appreciate the abundance of outdoor recreational opportunities available in the surrounding area, including hiking, fishing, skiing, and more. The nearby Bridger Mountains and Gallatin National Forest offer endless opportunities for exploration and adventure, making Southbridge an ideal desti
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

name: Cozy Loft | Well-Equipped, Walk to MSU & Downtown
description:
Experience the best of Bozeman in our beautifully decorated 1-bedroom guesthouse, located above the owners' garage. A perfect home base for MSU visits, downtown adventures, or ski days, this loft is ideally situated within walking distance to Montana State University, downtown Bozeman, parks, and trails. Enjoy a comfortable and well-equipped retreat that blends charm and convenience.

*Fully equipped kitchen
*Great wifi
*Laundry in unit
*Clean & bright
neighborhood_overview:
The loft sits above a garage in the Capitol Hill Subdivision, Bozeman's oldest historic neighborhood near the MSU campus. Main Street is less than a mile away, with excellent coffee shops and restaurants just blocks from home. Built in 1939, the house was renovated in 2016, including the loft where you're staying. The lush, pedestrian-friendly area offers a serene retreat with beautiful historic homes throughout the neighborhood.

The stay is conveniently located only 13 miles from Bozeman’s Yellowstone International Airport. Additionally, Bridger Bowl Ski Area and Crosscut Cross-Country Ski Area are a short 17-mile drive away, with Big Sky Resort just 43 miles from your doorstep. Explore the stunning North Entrance of Yellowstone, an easy 80-mile scenic drive from the property.

In addition to hiking, biking, and trail running accessible from town, you can enjoy fishing on the nearby East Gallatin and main Gallatin Rivers, horseback riding, rafting, tours of Yellow
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Cozy Guesthouse Near Downtown BZN
description:
Unwind in our cozy one-bedroom guesthouse in quiet Loyal Gardens, just 10 a minute drive from downtown Bozeman and MSU. Soak in the backyard hot tub or relax by the fire pit. Walk to nearby restaurants, salons, a brewery, and grocery store—everything you need for a peaceful, convenient stay.

*PLEASE NOTE: An adjacent construction project is planned, mid-April through July. Guest access will be maintained, some construction noise should be expected during those days during working hours.
neighborhood_overview: Loyal Gardens is a subdivision situated just outside of Bozeman off of Huffine and Cottonwood. It's a quiet, secluded neighborhood but close enough to be a convenient drive to everything in Bozeman. The Gallatin Valley Mall and other amenities are less than 5 minutes away. The Gallatin Range provides a gorgeous backdrop and South Cottonwood Canyon is just minutes away for those busy individuals who require quick outdoor fixes.  Loyal Gardens was formerly farmland and it shows with its open spaces, a pond, and walking trails winding throughout. There is also a playground for the kiddos to enjoy. The landscaping is impeccable and well thought out, with a variety of home styles. Loyal Gardens is a perfect place for families or for individuals who just want a quiet, friendly community to vacation in.
host_about: I'm a recovering engineer lucky enough to call Bozeman home.

Perfect for business or leisure travelers our pet friendly Bozeman hotel is your Rocky Mountain home.

name: Fantastic Location | Free Breakfast
description:
Residence Inn Bozeman Downtown Hotel is the perfect setting for an extraordinary Rocky Mountain experience.

Just nearby you can:
✔ Admire Yellowstone’s dramatic canyons, alpine rivers, lush forests, hot springs and gushing geysers
✔ Ski with an unforgettable view
✔ Explore the history of computing, communications, artificial intelligence and robotics
at The American Computer & Robotics Museum
✔ Watch a show at Ellen Theatre
✔ Take a tour at the award winning distillery Bozeman Spirits

— Yellowstone National Park – 1 h 37 min drive

name: Spacious Urban Living with Prime Main St. Access
description: Experience downtown living in this spacious 1,440 sq ft ground-floor unit, featuring two bedrooms and one stylish bathroom. Ideally located, this unit boasts modern finishes, in-unit laundry, and a welcoming layout designed for comfort. Just steps from Historic Main Street, enjoy Bozeman's vibrant restaurants, shops, and trails right outside your door. With a perfect blend of historic charm and contemporary amenities, this unit is ideal for those wanting to embrace the downtown lifestyle.
host_about:
I'm a Bozeman native who lives in Austin with my wife, four daughters and our goldendoodle, Burrbon. We've lived in Chicago, Baltimore, and perhaps one day we'll be back in Montana. Until then, we love getting up there to visit when we can. We love the Sweet Pea festival and skiing Bridger and Big Sky. 

We love travel, adventure and creating memories together as a family.

Just one block from Main Street, you’ll be steps from Bozeman’s best dining, shopping, galleries, and nightlife. As an early guest, your feedback is invaluable in perfecting this exceptional re
neighborhood_overview:
Bozeman has captured national attention as a thriving hub of adventure and opportunity, surrounded by majestic mountains and world-renowned rivers. Rouse House offers a rare blend of privacy and exclusivity in the heart of downtown, placing you within walking distance of the city’s best offerings.

Situated in the central business district, RH provides immediate access to Bozeman’s vibrant dining, shopping, and nightlife. Within six blocks, you’ll find a variety of exceptional restaurants and boutique shops, including Little Star Diner, a farm-to-table favorite just a block away, and Blackbird Kitchen, known for handcrafted pizzas and Italian-inspired cuisine. For a taste of France, visit Vienne Bakery & Café or indulge in artisanal chocolates at La Chatelaine Chocolat Co.
